name: firehydrant-mcp
long_description: FireHydrant MCP Server: An MCP server for interacting with FireHydrant's API.

api_key.title: api_key
api_key.description: The api_key to use for the request

tools.name: list-team-on-call-schedules
tools.description:
Lists all on-call schedules for a specific team. This is useful for:

  - Getting a list of on-call schedules for a team,
  - Finding available schedules to assign to incidents,
  - Viewing schedule configurations.

tools.name: get-team-on-call-schedule
tools.description:
Retrieves a specific on-call schedule for a team. This is useful for:

  - Getting detailed information about a specific schedule,
  - Viewing schedule rotations and members,
  - Checking schedule configuration.

tools.name: list-incidents
tools.description:
List incidents

List all of the incidents in the organization

tools.name: create-incident
tools.description:
Create an incident

Create a new incident

tools.name: list-retros-by-incident
tools.description:
Lists all retrospectives (RCAs) for an incident. Among other things, this is useful for:

  - Getting a list of retrospectives for an incident,
  - Getting basic data about a retrospective.
  - Getting the fields of a retrospective.

tools.name: update-retrospective-field
tools.description:
Updates a field in a retrospective (RCA) for an incident. Among other things, this is useful for:

  - Updating a field in a retrospective,
  - Updating the value of a field in a retrospective.

The value should be unstyled HTML.

tools.name: list-alerts
tools.description:
List alerts

Retrieve all alerts, including Signals alerts and third-party

tools.name: get-audience-incident-ai-summary
tools.description:
Retrieves the AI-generated summary for an incident tailored to a specific audience. This is useful for:

  - Getting audience-specific incident summaries,
  - Viewing summaries customized for different stakeholders,
  - Understanding how incidents are communicated to different audiences.

tools.name: get-incident-ai-summary
tools.description:
Retrieves the AI-generated summary for an incident. This is useful for:

  - Getting a concise AI summary of an incident,
  - Understanding incident context quickly,
  - Reviewing automated incident summaries.
